spiritus saitou wrote:

>Saitou in RK... just too cool for words,....  Itou in NHK's Shinsengumi!  --- two words:  Shosuke Tanihara.  ^_^  I would've followed *him* anywhere (and I wouldn't be alone, right Barb?).  I love his calm and intelligence and the way his face changes mood so quickly and effortlessly.
>  
>
*Nods head wildly* What Phil said yep! ^_^ RK Saitou is certainly at  in 
the top tier of the favorite list and I'm sure he inspired all of us  in 
some way or other and i know it's the reason I became so interested in 
learning more about the real man and his cohorts.

Itou/Tanihara...there are not enough words, but I know the phrase "Sonno 
Joi" never sounded so good before he said it.

I also like NHK Takeda and Okita.

_Love_ PMK Yamanami and also like the NHK version

PMK Yamazaki also the best the ones from NHK and Gohatto/Taboo are _just 
Wrong_

I think Jo Odagiri in NHK was an excellent Saitou and I like Koichi 
Sato's  nasty tempered version in Mibu Gishi Den (which was close to the 
RK version imho)

Koichi scored the _absolute best_ Serizawa in NHK

and #1 Okita has to be Mibu Gishi Den too and that Nagakura was very 
cool but so under used :(.

--
